alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 05 at 5:15AM PST until January 05 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE RIVER COMPLEX BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Coffee Creek portions of the River Complex burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Northern Trinity. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the western portions of the River Complex burn scar is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Coffee Creek portions of the River Complex burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall is expected over the western portions of the River Complex burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
